detailed_data.name: Old Quarter
detailed_data.description: Hanoi’s lively Old Quarter comprises nearly 40 streets packed with shops selling all kinds of goods, each street named for its primary good or service.

detailed_data.name: Mf Spa Hanoi
detailed_data.address: 11 Bao Khanh Alley Hang Trong, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
detailed_data.description: In the heart of Hanoi’s Old Quarter, surrounded by history and charm, lies MF Spa Hanoi, a sanctuary of renewal and rejuvenation. Here, the East harmonizes with the West, and ancient philosophies meet contemporary techniques to create an unparalleled healing experience. This haven of tranquility blends advanced global therapies with regional holistic traditions, drawing on nature's local treasures to restore balance and provide an extraordinary opportunity for deep relaxation and recovery. For an unforgettable romantic experience, MF Spa Hanoi boasts a luxurious treatment room designed for couples, where lovebirds can cherish each other's company amidst serenity and peace. MF Spa Hanoi—truly relax.

detailed_data.name: Lake of the Restored Sword (Hoan Kiem Lake)
detailed_data.description: A rare breed of turtle enjoys this popular lake almost as much as countless locals and tourists. Hoan Kiem Lake is a dynamic daily tableau, from morning walks amid locals doing exercises on the shore, to young couples water-gazing on park benches, to the multiple shopping and sight-seeing opportunities in the vicinity.  Centrally located in the city, Hoan Kiem Lake serves as a massive home base, and provides endless people-watching and recreational opportunities on the edge of the Old Quarter.

detailed_data.name: L'essence Spa
detailed_data.description: WELCOME TO LESSENCE GROUP INTRODUCTION The Lessence Group (LSG) has come a long way since the original members’ humble beginnings running a mini Spa in Hanoi’s Old Quarter at the end of 2015. Ours is an inspirational story. Founding owner and group Chairman, Nguyen Van Duy, and his team dreamt of building a professional boutique Spa group founded on superb customer service. Working hard, knowing how to take risks, natural instinct and sheer love of creating wonderful luxurious memories exceeding expectations were, and are our trademark. The challenging early days were made harder due to limited funds. Plus, our team was very young, trying hard to introduce a new concept into a competitive Spa market. But, our passion, open-minded approach, and unfailing determination paid off. Working 24/7 we laid LSG’s foundations and set a new trend for the Spa industry. Our goal is to consistently give every guest outstanding personal service from the heart focusing on sophistication, luxury.

detailed_data.name: Apron Up Cooking Class
detailed_data.description: Apron Up Cooking Class was found in 2015 with the aim of introducing Vietnamese cuisine and culture to the outside world. We have been hosting hundreds of thousands of people who are eager to immerse themselves in our culture and enjoy a local meal. Our class bases in Old quarter, Hanoi so it is easy to reach and save time to discover the neighborhood. Our priority is to bring you a meaningful yet entertaining experience while you are in our home.

detailed_data.name: Omamori Spa Hà Nội
detailed_data.description: Omamori Spa is a chain of massage center established and run by BlindLink, established in 2013, a leading and pioneering social impact organization providing training opportunities in the area of wellness to the Vietnamese blind community at large. BlindLink's aim is to create a better standard of living and greater self-esteem to this deserving group of citizens. The business concept of Omamori Spa is unique because of the professional staff employed, the affordable prices for a high quality massage service offered, the no-tip-policy, the relaxing atmosphere in the spa facilities and most importantly because of the social support provided to the blind and visually impaired Vietnamese people. One locations in Hanoi is 48 Ngo Huyen str., Hoan Kiem, Hanoi with blind therapists. Minimum charge: 300,000 VND/60 minutes. Opening hours: Mon-Sun 9:00 am - 10:30 pm

detailed_data.name: Midori Spa Hanoi
detailed_data.description: Midori Hanoi Spa is a social enterprise providing training and employment opportunities young blind Vietnam as masseur. It was helped by the Vietnam Blind Association. Until 2013, estimates in Vietnam have 2 million visually impaired. Most face a desperate future, entirely dependent on others with no opportunities for education or work. Training and employment initiatives like this one are desperately need to help them to generate their own incomes and lead dignified, independent lives. At Midori Hanoi Spa, the entire staff had been trained therapist skills and be tested monthly under the supervision, training and support by Mido Spa. Our principle is to ensure absolute customer satisfaction. Welcome!

detailed_data.name: Peony Garden Spa
detailed_data.description:
"I chose a 1-hour relaxing oriental massage by a very kind and friendly masseuse, even though I didn't expect the relaxing massage to be “dynamic” "" so.
However, it was well done and helped me relax, which is what matters 😊
Great experience at Peony Garden Spa, I really appreciate the welcome at the spa. The support is really very pleasant.
While drinking some tea, first fill out a small sheet of paper to describe your current state (tired, stressed, etc.)
You can choose to personalize your ritual etc. I think all of this can be done on the iPad when entering the cabin because once you have everything done, you will enter the cabin and confirm everything with my esthetician. described on the form. I see that this is duplicated. Then when it was time for the ceremony, I was left alone for an Ayurvedic massage. I loved my treatment, yen was very professional, very meticulous and she took the time to check that everything was going well during the treatment (temperature, massage pressure, zones) It's perfect! Thank you very much 🥰
I will come back with great pleasure because this was a very good massage ritual, I will try other treatments, thank you again 🧘‍♀️ I really recommend!"

detailed_data.name: Blue Butterfly Cooking Class
detailed_data.description: We cook a lot back at home, so we had high expectations in local cooking classes in Hanoi, not just something touristy. Chef Hung Pickle chatted with us to understand our preferences and swapped banh xeo for spring rolls. We started the beef stock, and while the stock was simmering, we went out to the market. The short ride to the market was another small sightseeing experience for us! The market tour was interesting and we bought a few things there for our future use as well. We learned a lot of tips from Chef Hung (beyond foreign cookbooks), and we feel confident to remake the dishes back home. In fact, we plan to cook the dishes this coming weekend while our memory is fresh! ðŸ˜¹

detailed_data.name: Walt Disney World Resort
detailed_data.description: This world-famous Resort consists of four Theme Parks (Magic Kingdom Park, Epcot, Disney’s Hollywood Studios, Disney’s Animal Kingdom Theme Park), two Water Parks (Disney’s Typhoon Lagoon Water Park, Disney’s Blizzard Beach Water Park), over 25 Resort hotel properties, and a variety of additional entertainment offerings.

detailed_data.name: Gurara Water Falls
detailed_data.address: AddressMinna - Abuja Expressway, Niger State, Gurara 910102 Nigeria
detailed_data.description: It is 100km from Wuse2/central abuja. The Road is well tarred to gurara, aside a 3km stretch midway, which took 20mins to navigate. Total Journey time on powerbikes was 90mims to and 70mins back. Always quicker returning!!The PROSThe waterfall itself is an amazing tourist location and best enjoyed as a group. Pack ur own food and drinks as there isnt much at the location to feast upon. Danjuma the tour guide was brilliant. He was patient, knows the best spot for great pix, very helpful in helping u navigate the terrain and he takes excellent pix, if you hand him your phone/camera.The walking and dipping under the cascading waterfall lasted about two hours. Then another one hour recovering before riding back to abujaThere are several other things enroute that u may wish to stop for such as farmers market, Zuma rock (watch out for the monkeys that will pelt u with rocks if u tried climbing too high on to Zuma). A slight detour also takes you into the popular suleja market. So set off early. Its potentially a full day of activities.The CONS:If driving, check traffic updates very well before setting off.  Zuba and Madalla traffic was horrible the day we went due to road works.  Felt pity for those in cars. We rode, thankfully! The location is also poorly signed posted. Infact, the only signage was at the entrance (97km from our departure point). So if you dont have google map, u will have to keep asking.The guys at the gate also extort. They charged us N2k each as entrance fee, with no receipt issued. I guess Niger State govt dont need the revenue. Meant to be N500 apparently but having travelled that far, we had no choice. Still worth the 2k, if receipted!!

detailed_data.name: Handara Iconic Gate
detailed_data.description: Handara Iconic Gate is a famous landmark in Bali, Indonesia, known for its striking traditional Balinese gate structure. Located at the entrance of the Handara Golf & Resort, it has become a popular spot for photoshoots due to its majestic design, surrounded by lush green landscapes and misty mountains in the background.

detailed_data.name: LEGOLAND Discovery Center Westchester
detailed_data.description: LEGOLAND® Discovery Center Westchester is the ultimate indoor LEGO® playground. This indoor amusement center is ideal for children aged 3-10 years—with millions of LEGO bricks under one roof, their imagination is the only limitation. Children can build bricktastic memories with 12 LEGO themed attractions including 2 rides, a 4D Cinema, NYC MINILAND and more. Put Ninja skills to the ultimate test in LEGO NINJAGO City Adventure, add creations to a LEGO City-scape in LEGO City Builder, race your car creations down our Build & Test track, pick out the perfect LEGO set in our LEGO Shop or relax with a Starbucks™ beverage in the coffee shop. Please note, LEGOLAND Discovery Center is specifically designed for children so all adults must be accompanied by a child.

detailed_data.name: Watergate
detailed_data.description: Came to celebrate a friend’s birthday, a group of 5 people from all over EuropeAfter queuing for more than 2 hours holding a regular ticket we were told off by a very rude and offensive lady at the entrance. detailed_data.name: The Mayan Baths
detailed_data.description: I booked this for a private event for 18 guests (male & female) on a Friday before my friend's wedding.  It was amazing!  I coordinated the private booking from the US via WhatsApp and used google translate to assist.  It was an easy process.  The coordinator was friendly and responsive to my questions given the time difference.  As a private party we had the facility to ourselves which included access to the indoor/outdoor thermal pools.  We organized various package services listed on the website and lunch served in the overlooking veranda (both based on each of the 18 people's specific service/drink package and lunch request which we provided in advance).  When we arrived, we were greeted and shown into the locker rooms for changing.  The facility was clean and had an attendant for the ladies room.  Robes & sandals were provided as well as secure lockers for the ladies. The bar staff was very attentive and quick to replenish our beverages.  The Thermal baths were wonderful.  The water was warm, clear, and clean.  The indoor thermals have an outside nook where the bar is located.  The grounds surrounding the facility had beautiful manicured landscaping & gardens around the outdoor pool and veranda.  There are lounge chairs available for sunbathing in the outdoor pool area.  We reserved the space for 6 hours (10am - 4pm).  They were able to accommodate the 17 people (one opted out of a massage and just enjoyed the thermals) who requested massages using 4 massage therapists in 2 rooms that can service 2 people at a time using a curtain divider.   The main course lunch options were Arrachera or Chicken breast with a salad appetizer and custard dessert.  All of which was prepared perfectly and tasted delicious.  I chose this location specifically because it does not allow children. This place is fantastic and I would absolutely book a private event with them again. I cannot recommend the Mayan Baths more highly!

detailed_data.name: Daunt Books
detailed_data.description: Marylebone offers what so many London neighborhoods cannot: a village feel coupled with urban convenience. Much of its success rests in its location. Wedged between the northeastern corner of Hyde Park and the southern end of Regent's Park and with a number of Tube stations within easy reach, Marylebone is as pedestrian friendly as Central London gets. The bustling shopping mecca of Oxford Street separates it from Soho and Mayfair, exclusive Regent Street marks its border with Fitzrovia, and cosmopolitan Edgware Road serves as its western edge. Within this enviably situated quarter are an array of outstanding restaurants (from Michelin darlings to down and dirty cheeseburgers), an impressive assortment of independently owned shops, and some of the city's quietest and most pleasant nooks, crannies and cobbled lanes.

detailed_data.name: Ha Ha Tonka State Park
detailed_data.description: Imposing architecture and breathtaking scenery combine to make Ha Ha Tonka State Park one of Missouri’s most treasured spots. Located on the Lake of the Ozarks, the park features the stone ruins of a turn-of-the-20th-century castle built by a prominent Kansas City businessman high atop a bluff. More than 15 miles of trails traverse the park, leading visitors to sinkholes, natural bridges, caves and down to the lake.

detailed_data.name: Mineralbad & Spa Rigi Kaltbad
detailed_data.description: The large granite building extends from the outside to the inside and therefore it comes across as very cold, colorless and unfriendly. The furnishings are all gray or beige and that doesn't help either. The bistro doesn't really deserve its name because it was probably just the reception lounge before and now it has 3 tables and serves sandwiches and quiches, very spartan in its selection and not very wellness-like. No amenities in the showers. All in all, the whole atmosphere, including the service, comes across as very monotonous and not very 2024 lifestyle-like. I think with a bit of creativity and willpower it could be freshened up relatively cheaply and quickly but in the meantime we won't be returning.

detailed_data.name: Salda Golu
detailed_data.description: Visited this place . The government has decided that part of the lake must be preserved in its form and tourists cannot access the water part. You have to stay behind the ropes that span this one. However, 2 km further to the campsite you can swim in the lake casually. The water is pleasant , but the mud mush sticks well to your body . It also looks like white sand , but to me it looks more like white ground pebbles and it feels like that . If you go to the official entrance you pay 60 lira but you will be taken by electric transport to the lake and back. I was the only tourist on 05 /07/2024 . Rest assured :) to the campsite free

detailed_data.name: Wilder Ranch State Park
detailed_data.description: We went to the park to see the cliffs and had even greater fund seeing the variety of birds on the rocks and many seals on the beach even more. The first few views of the cliffs were nice, and we took many pictures of them. But as we walked further, we realized the views got even better. Even though we were told that it was not yet the season for seals to congregate there (in late October), we were fortunate to have found many of them. It took a walk of about 45 minutes, with stops to take photos, to reach the area with seals.

detailed_data.name: Little Venice
detailed_data.description: The « little Venice » is the name given to the course of the Lauch in Colmar. This name probably came from the original line of the houses on both sides of the river, which serves the southeast of the city. This district starts behind the Koïfhus, goes through the fishmonger's district and to the bridges Turenne and Saint-Pierre. It is therefore at the beginning of the Krutenau, whose etymology refers to places of market gardening on the outskirts of the towns. Originally inhabited by a rural community of wine-producers, market gardeners and boatmen, the Krutenau stretches out around the Turenne Street that the marshal took in 1674 for his triumphant entry in the city. Boat rides are possible there.

detailed_data.name: Boggy Creek Airboat Adventures
detailed_data.description: Welcome to our enchanted 32-acre park, where adventure awaits around every corner. Explore the lighted brick pathways that wind along the beautiful lake, surrounded by nature's wonders. Get up-close and personal with Florida's favorite reptiles on an airboat adventure. Immerse yourself in the vibrant beauty of native butterflies, wildlife, and plants in Lily's Butterfly Garden. Embark on a mining adventure as you sift through buckets of soil, uncovering semi-precious gems, fossils, and crystals. Witness our living history museum and learn from descendants of the Jororo Tribe, “The Forgotten Tribe of Florida” and discover a primitive way of living at our authentic Native American Village. Wrap up your visit with a delicious lakeside meal at Boggy Bottoms BBQ. Join us and escape to nature!

detailed_data.name: Rolling Geeks
detailed_data.description: You know how you always wanted a robot? Well here's one on wheels. Rolling Geeks are cars that talk. No, not like Knightrider - think more like C-3PO ... with attitude. They're little electric powered cars, very easy to drive, complete with pre-programmed GPS showing you where to go, and what to look at when you're there. With Rolling Geeks you get all of the knowledge of a tour guide, but with the freedom to park up, get out, and explore whenever you want to - and trust us, you'll want to. In just 2.5 hours you can see 3 of the richest historical cities in Malta, discovering incredible areas you just couldn't manage in a whole day on foot. Enjoy the sights of Birgu (Vittoriosa), Isla (Senglea), Bormla (Cospicua) and Kalkara, while the car tells you about them in English, German, French, Italian, Spanish, Dutch, Russian or Mandarin. And the car takes also selfies!! Rolling Geeks are tours with street smarts - it's how we roll.

detailed_data.name: Vassilakis Estate
detailed_data.description: The accumulated experience of five generations goes into every bottle of award-winning Vassilakis Estate extra virgin olive oil. The Vassilakis family have been producing olive oil since 1865, and are today one of Crete’s top exporters. The secret to the success of Vassilakis Estate is commitment to sustainable cultivation practices that preserve the soil, conserve water and keep their centenarian olive trees naturally healthy. And the modern olive mill, which has been voted “Best Greek Olive Oil Producer and Bottler”, has five international quality and food safety certifications. Vassilakis Estate olive oil brands are exported to trade and individual customers in 26 countries around the world. Strict maintenance of the highest standards ensures that every bottle of Vassilakis olive oil reaches each customer at harvest-fresh quality. The range includes 5 extra virgin and organic extra virgin olive oils, each with its own organoleptic profile, and all have won multiple awards.

detailed_data.description:
Experience the difference with our signature Combination Massage — thoughtfully designed to blend multiple techniques into one harmonious session. Whether it’s your very first massage or you’re a seasoned pro, we’re confident you’ll love what we do. After all, we’ve delivered over 87,600 massages and counting.

Our Combination Massage is a two-part treatment that integrates various massage styles to suit your needs. It begins with our revitalizing foot reflexology, focusing on the lower body — feet, legs, and calves — before transitioning to a personalized upper body massage. In the second half, we concentrate on your neck, shoulders, and lower back, tailoring the experience to your preferences and areas of tension.

This massage is perfect for anyone exploring different techniques or simply wanting to enjoy the best of several modalities in one session. Let us help you discover what relaxation truly feels like.

detailed_data.name: Lang Toi - My Village by Lune Production
detailed_data.address: 01 Trang Tien Hanoi Opera House, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
detailed_data.description: Lang Toi is one of the Vietnamese Bamboo Circus shows, now performing in Hanoi. Lang Toi, also known as My Village, is a delicate merging of tradition and innovation, where the poetic beauty of Vietnamese village life is laid out, astonishingly, in a Bamboo Circus. Farming, building activities, traditional games, and the lifestyles of villagers are re-created through the traditional media of ancestral bamboo, in breathtaking circus performances. You will experience eye-popping contortions, stunning acrobatics, and juggling that might take your breath away. Enchanting folk melodies are created live on stage from more than twenty exotic traditional musical instruments. Since 2009 the show has gained worldwide recognition with over a thousand performances in Vietnam and overseas.

detailed_data.name: Thuy Design House - Ha Noi
detailed_data.description: Thuy Design House, led by founder Thuỷ Nguyễn, celebrates Vietnam's cultural heritage through elegant fashion. Their collections blend traditional textiles and handicraft techniques with modern trends. Established in 2011, the brand offers ready-to-wear and bespoke garments, reflecting contemporary Vietnamese fashion. Vibrant colors, intricate embellishments, and Vietnamese craft influences define their designs. Thuy Design House has gained popularity among celebrities and fashion enthusiasts, featured in renowned shows like Vietnam International Fashion Week. Thuỷ's contributions to design earned her a spot on Forbes Vietnam's influential women list. Beyond fashion, Thuỷ ventured into filmmaking, producing "The Tailor," exploring the cultural significance of the áo dài. She also established The Factory Contemporary Arts Centre in Saigon, dedicated to contemporary art and culture.

detailed_data.name: Telecabine Lisboa
detailed_data.description: This neighborhood was built up at the end of the 1990s mostly because of the Expo '98. The pavilions and structures that once were the home of all the Expo's attractions and exhibits are still culturally and artistically significant. In Parque das Nações you'll explore conference and concert pavilions, a shopping center, trendy restaurants and an enjoyable cable car ride you can't miss out on. On top of this, the amazing Lisbon Oceanarium (one of the most spectacular things you'll ever see in the city) will take your breath away: its respect and will to preserve natural wildlife is uncanny. Easily accessible by metro, bus or taxi from the city center, Parque das Nações is highly recommended for anyone who'll spend more than 3 days in the Portuguese capital.

detailed_data.name: Elephant Rocks State Park
detailed_data.description: The elephant-shaped boulders at Elephant Rocks State Park may not be the stars of a circus, but these giant granite boulders are the stars of this unusual park in southeast Missouri. An easy way to see the rocks is from the Braille Trail, which was especially designed for people with visual and physical disabilities. The trail winds through the main area of rocks. An extension off the trail leads back to the ruins of an old railroad engine house, a remnant of the area’s quarrying and railroad history. Picnic tables are scattered among the trees and provide inviting spots to have a picnic lunch or rest and enjoy the interesting geologic formations found throughout the park.

detailed_data.name: Golden Dragon Water Puppet Theater
detailed_data.description: Generations ago, Vietnamese puppeteers performed for their rural communities in waist-deep water, bringing to life legends and stories about their region. Water puppetry theaters like Golden Dragon Water Puppet Theater continue that tradition into the modern day and are a fun, family-friendly way to experience a hallmark of traditional Vietnamese culture.water puppet show, which is closely associated with the spiritual life of Vietnamese people, especially in the countryside. The show’s chosen stage is the surface of a water pool. The puppeteers present their clever skills in managing puppets by long bamboo rods and string mechanism under the surface. A traditional Vietnamese orchestra is an excellent music accompaniment. The puppets depict the story from the songs during the show, which reflects the peaceful life of the Vietnamese countryside, so it is not too difficult to understand it.

detailed_data.name: Madu River Safari by Buddhi
detailed_data.description: Welcome to Madu River Boat Safari, your gateway to the hidden beauty of Madu Ganga in Balapitiya, Sri Lanka. Embark on an unforgettable boat ride through this enchanting lagoon, renowned for its 64 islands and rich biodiversity. Our journey begins as you board our fully insured boat, navigating through a stunning natural mangrove cave. Along the way, you'll visit Cinnamon Island, where you can witness the traditional cinnamon manufacturing process. Marvel at rural fishermen in their traditional catamarans, adding to the picturesque charm of the lagoon. Keep an eye out for diverse wildlife that thrives in this serene environment. Discover peaceful temple nestled on the Koth Duwa, and end your journey with a unique fish therapy experience, where fish gently nibble at your feet, enhancing circulation and sensation. Join us for an immersive Madu River boat safari, where our expert team ensures you have an unforgettable day trip in Sri Lanka.

detailed_data.name: Hanoi Cooking Centre
detailed_data.description: Hanoi Cooking Centre established in 2009, remains Hanoi's only purpose built cooking school and culinary centre. A variety of cooking classes and street food tours are available twice daily. All classes begin with welcome tea, while a chef gives a brief introduction to the local Chau Long market and Vietnamese market culture generally. After a 3 minute walk guests arrive at the market and are immediately submerged into the hustle, bustle and wonder of one of the last remaining wet markets in Hanoi. Our chef will explain the produce and offer various samples along the way. After returning to the centre you will then participate in a 'hands-on' cooking class and the morning / afternoon finishes in our air-conditioned restaurant where you and your class mates can enjoy the dishes you have prepared along with free flow drinks. All guests receive a complimentary and much sort after Hanoi Cooking Centre apron and recipe cards. Class + lunch = approximately 3.5hrs For guests preferring a more adventurous time, our 5 hour street food tour also includes the market tour and then takes guests to 5 of the best known (amongst the locals and our HCC staff) street food venues across Hanoi. The number 1 rule for this tour = come hungry! For guests with limited time try our Market Tour & Lunch or Dinner package for a truly authentic Hanoi culinary experience.

detailed_data.name: Hanoi Flowers Art Tour
detailed_data.description: Wonderful experience in Hanoi to learn about the beautiful tradition of flowers arrangement by local artists. The art of flower arrangement as offerings of Vietnamese, used for buddhism, ancestor veneration and lunar festivities, have been around for hundreds of years. This beautiful tradition was disappearing in modern urban life, however, in 2020, a flower shop has revived the Hanoi spiritual flowers arrangements art and brought it to the new level. Comida Ngon uses creativity and a new artistic approach to rearrange the spiritual flowers, package them and sell them only. By joining these tours, tourists can learn about the spiritual lives of Vietnamese people, get to know the exotic fragrances of oriental flowers, and learn about aromas and sharps. Tourists can also learn how to arrange the flowers themself under the guidance of the local artists and interact with the florists. This is a beautiful exotic experience for all travelers visiting Hanoi

detailed_data.name: High Cliff State Park
detailed_data.description: We stayed for 2 nights in the family campground. Sites were well maintained and well shaded. There are several pit toilets within the campground which were very clean for being pit toilets. The hardstand bathrooms and showers were also very clean and well kept. They have a filtered water bottle refill station at the bathrooms too which was super nice. Right at the front of the family campsites is a small playground to give the kids something to do.There is a TON to do at this park. The trails are pretty kid friendly. One is paved, two are packed dirt. The Lime Kiln is the only one we didn't hike as it seemed to be a bit more advanced. Definitely check out the Indian Mounds. Such an amazing piece of history there. If you like geocaching, there are many caches in the park and most were a quick find with our kids.We saw a total of 3 playgrounds - in the campground, by the beach, and on the far side of the park by the observation tower.The beach - OK its mostly grass - was clean. There are a lot of shells close to the shore, but then it's clear, sandy bottom. You can swim way out there and still touch the bottom. These were the only bathroomsNow on to a list of pros and cons for camping...Pros: there are a ton of families. If you have kids, they'll make friends. Everyone congregated at the playground and had a blast.-People respect the quiet hours.-The camp host was friendly and helpful.-The entire campground is very, very well maintained. Every site is super well shaded.-Bugs were minimal in terms of mosquitos, even after the rain we just had (although I am writing this mid June, maybe we just got lucky because it's been fairly cold til now).-Also dog friendly, lots of doggos within the site (and people were cleaning up after them - yay).Cons: there are a ton of families. If kids aren't your jam, it may get annoying. We sat at the park with our kids, but there were a lot of unattended, screaming children. They quieted down around 9:30, but...I know thats not everyone's cup of tea.-There are also 4 legged friends 🦝 who paid us a visit and tried to get in our screen tent. I mean, it's a big park. There's going to be raccoons. It just wasn't pleasant to be awoken at 2 AM to them screeching 🤣 Keep your food locked up good.-If you're at the back of the campground, the trail runs RIGHT behind your campsite. Could be awkward. If you're at the front, you're by the playground.-Also, we got stuck by a large RV who couldn't back in to their site. Our site was a tight squeeze due to a tree in the middle of the driveway. The sites at the back seemed to be angled weird so this guy was really struggling. If you have a bigger trailer or RV, I'd consider a site in the middle of the grounds so you're not on a sharp curve trying to back in.Overall - Definitely a park we'll camp at again. I hope this was helpful!

detailed_data.name: Comic-con Museum
detailed_data.description:
My family visited this museum for the first time on a Monday afternoon. Based on the online reviews and information from the museum's website, I had certain expectations. However, after our visit, I found the experience to be just okay and felt it didn’t fully justify the $25 entrance fee.

The museum primarily features framed comic book covers from various comics around the world. There is also a revolving themed display, and during our visit, it showcased the history of Betty Boop. This display was quite interesting, with several authentic hand-painted animation cells on exhibit. Additionally, a small theater on the lower level played a continuous loop of Betty Boop movies, which was a nice touch.

That said, I was hoping for a greater variety of items on display beyond framed art and book covers.

The museum also has a small gift shop offering related merchandise.

For children and adults, there’s a scavenger hunt game where participants can earn a free poster by finding all the items on the list, which adds a fun interactive element.

detailed_data.name: Sumilon Island
detailed_data.description:
Discovering Sumilon Island in Oslob is like stumbling upon a hidden gem in the heart of paradise. With just a quick 10-15 minute boat ride from the wharf, you're transported to a place of utter tranquility and natural splendor.

For the ultimate experience, I'd recommend starting your day with an early morning adventure, setting off around 7 am. Since there aren't any fancy amenities like cottages or tables on the island, it's best to come prepared with your own picnic essentials – a cozy blanket, some delicious snacks, and, of course, a commitment to keeping the island clean and pristine.

Sumilon is privately owned, and let me tell you, they know how to pamper their guests. You can opt for a luxurious overnight stay at their upscale hotel and resort or go for a day trip with options like Klook's day pass, which gives you access to exclusive perks like cottages, tables, and even a refreshing pool. But if you're on a budget, don't worry – you can still enjoy the island's beauty with public access, although you'll have to stick to certain areas.

Navigating the island is a breeze with the help of local boat guides, especially when it comes to timing your visit. Trust me, you'll want to make the most of the cooler morning temperatures before the sun reaches its peak around 10 am. So don't forget to pack your essentials – a sturdy umbrella, a comfy chair, and, most importantly, plenty of sunscreen to keep you protected from the tropical rays.

Whether you're starting your day with a dose of island magic or sneaking away for a peaceful mid-morning retreat, Sumilon Island promises an experience you won't soon forget. So come, lose yourself in its serene beauty, and let the coastal wonders of Oslob leave a lasting imprint on your soul.

detailed_data.name: Te Pā Tū (2025) - All You Need to Know BEFORE You Go (with Reviews)
detailed_data.description: Te Pā Tū offers 3.5 hour evening experiences that change with each season of the maramataka, the Māori lunar calendar. Feast on song, drama, tradition, and divine seasonal kai (cuisine) within our forest Pā (village) - its towering Tawa trees, blazing bonfires, and forest-formed amphitheatre. Traditional hāngi joins seasonal Māori delicacies prepared with fusion cooking techniques. Cultural knowledge unique to each season is shared through rituals, songs, stories across the evening as is local, seasonal kai (food) - plentiful and delicious. Kai horotai (indigenous canapes) are followed by a torch lit walk to a lavish 4-course Māori fusion feast. Tū Te Ihi – Winter Matariki Celebration: References the energy and passion stirred by the Matariki cluster and the promise they herald. Tū Te Ihi celebrates a moment in the earth’s cycle when the stars of Matariki (Pleiades) draw our attention. Matariki conjures our ancestors as we recall their legacy, and reflect on the year that has been.

detailed_data.name: Bay Voyager
detailed_data.description: Bay Voyager is happy to announce the opening of our new location at Pier 39 in San Francisco! The range of tours offered by Bay Voyager include viewing historic ships, visiting former mooring sites of abandoned gold rush ships, and experiencing active estuaries populated by cargo ships and tug boats. You’ll see the San Francisco waterfront, cruise under the Golden Gate Bridge, around Alcatraz, Under the Bay Bridge to the Port of Oakland, past AT&T Park (Home to the San Francisco Giants) and Back to Pier 39. While Bay Voyager does have specific routes, deviation is an integral part of the experience, making each adventure an engaging and exhilarating encounter.According to owner and captain, Charles Jennings, “we feel there is a need to provide more intimate and individualized tours that travel closer and give more in depth guided tours. By being in a small and agile vessel, guests can have an up close and personal adventure while traveling to all corners of the always-fascinating bay.”

Experience Manila with us while supporting our local community work! Our signature Tours are the Slum Tours - our most popular tours that goes through the slums of Manila, wherein profits are donated to our current community projects. detailed_data.name: Montenvers – Mer De Glace
detailed_data.description: Enjoy history and glaciology It takes about twenty minutes to climb the 1,000 metres up to the Montenvers-Mer de Glace attraction. Simply hop on board the famous little red railway train. Time will stand still, and you’ll enjoy this vintage method of transport. The track climbs the mountainside, running through the forest, tunnels cut through the rock and over viaducts. You enter the realm of the high mountains, and round the last bend you’ll feel the magic: you’ve arrived at your destination at the foot of the famous Mer de Glace glacier, at an altitude of 1,913m. A stunning panorama opens out before you, with the glacier below, an excellent testament to the climate change in this day and age.

detailed_data.name: Jucy Camper Rental
detailed_data.address: Reach out directlyVisit websiteCallEmail
detailed_data.description:
Absolutely Disgraceful – Avoid This Company at All Costs!

If I could give zero stars, I would. Our experience with this company was an absolute nightmare from start to finish, and their treatment of my family has been nothing short of appalling.

We rented a camper from their Cairns branch in early January, expecting a smooth and enjoyable trip. Instead, we were handed a faulty, unsafe vehicle that was completely unfit for purpose. The bed was broken, the toilet was unusable, and critical fittings were missing or incorrectly installed. We had no choice but to sleep on the couch for multiple nights, despite my aunt being a recovering cancer patient. The stress and discomfort this caused her were completely unacceptable.

When the bed first broke, we were forced to wait hours for a mechanic, missing an entire day of our holiday. The so-called “repair” lasted less than 48 hours before the bed broke again, leaving us stranded and forced to divert all the way to Brisbane—a destination that was never in our itinerary—to exchange the camper. Despite this massive inconvenience, we were still charged for tolls and fuel for the journey that was only necessary due to their faulty vehicle!

Their customer service was disgraceful—rude, dismissive, and unwilling to help. It took hours on the phone just to get basic assistance, and every step of the way, they refused to take responsibility. When we finally returned the camper early because the replacement was of lower quality and completely unsuitable, the Sydney branch supervisor was shocked at how we had been treated.

Now, after weeks of back-and-forth emails, the company is refusing to pay us the compensation we are legally entitled to. Instead, they have told us to take them to court if we want to recover our costs. This company ruined a once-in-a-lifetime trip for my family, and their refusal to provide any real remedy under Australian Consumer Law is disgusting.

Do yourself a favor—DO NOT book with this company. Their vehicles are unsafe, their service is atrocious, and they will leave you stranded and out of pocket rather than take responsibility for their failures. Spend your money elsewhere and avoid this scam of a business!

detailed_data.name: Turkish Market
detailed_data.description: Sample a slice of Turkish culture in the heart of Berlin—twice a week, vendors set up shop at this popular street market located in the Neukolln neighborhood, selling some of the freshest produce in town. Locals come here to stock up on pantry staples like sundried tomatoes, olives, and goat’s cheese, as well as fruits and vegetables not commonly found in commercial supermarkets. On your tour, enjoy Turkish specialties like baklava, kebabs, and freshly made gozleme—flatbread pastry with mouthwatering savory fillings. The market operates all year round—check the schedule before you head down. – Tripadvisor

detailed_data.name: Námafjall Hverir
detailed_data.description:
We visited the Námafjall Hverir area as we arrived into the Myvatn area from the east and this was one of the first areas you arrive at. Needless to say, you can smell this place before you see it - especially if you have the car vents on! Being an area of strong geothermal activity the smell of sulphur is strong...very strong! It could possibly be a bit overbearing if you're not great with potent smells or have a dodgy stomach. 

The area itself is very interesting, having paid for parking we headed over to the boiling mud pools and to admire the incredibly colourful landscape. If you've seen geothermal mud pits before its likely to be just a good place to stretch your legs as opposed to fascinating but either way its definitely worth a stop. The parking was 1200Kr for the day so it isn't going to break the bank however there are no facilities there so its quite limited how long you'd actually want to spend. It was quite interesting that this was more expensive to park at than any of the other local sights around it -  not sure of the justification for that but there you go.

!!!HUGE TIP!!!
Wear boots as the paths are very muddy and sulphur rich so its bright yellow mud! We seen plenty of people wearing what were supposed to be bright white Nike trainers - they didn't last long! It would be great if there was a tap and a boot brush that could be used in the car park but alas we thankfully had some hand wipes in the car to clean off the excess we couldn't shake off.

Indulge in the rhythm of music accompanied by your loved ones, under the stars holding a unique cocktail. Arabella has been loved by the people, many events have taken place in it: such as its participation in those of the Ministry of Culture. with the theme of ancient ports in the Thermaic Gulf, photos for fashion magazines, video clips and countless receptions and parties. It makes 30-minute trips daily starting from the White Tower, heading to the commercial port and back. Its capacity is about 160 people. The ship is 25 meters long and 20 m high (14 m. Mast), while its draft is 2.8 meters.

detailed_data.name: Illinois Railway Museum
detailed_data.description: The Illinois Railway Museum is the largest museum of its kind in America. Ride historic trains on the museum's five-mile demonstration railroad. See giant steam locomotives, powerful diesels and elegant electric cars on display and in operation. Enjoy educational displays, a train-themed playground for children, and immersive exhibits. Bring a picnic or dine at the Central Avenue Diner. The museum's collection includes such highlights as the "Nebraska Zephyr" streamliner, featured in the movie "A League of Their Own;" the 1941 "Electroliner" train which helped inspire Japan's famous Bullet trains; the last surviving "Green Hornet" streetcar from Chicago; and a 1918 steam locomotive originally built for export to Imperial Russia.

detailed_data.name: Horseshoe Bay Beach

The beach is especially popular during the summer months, with a lifeguard on duty and a beachside cafe serving delicious food. If you're lucky, you might be able to catch a weekly beach volleyball competition. Be sure to explore the beautiful cove on the west end of the beach, where sea stacks create a natural pool that's perfect for a refreshing swim. detailed_data.name: Crooked Island Beach
detailed_data.description: Make sure you have your d-bids card before going. They will check.. absolutely beautiful beach. Clean, quiet and beautiful water. There are rays and sharks so beware. Saw a 3 foot then a 5 foot ( water was crystal clear and I'm guessing the sizes) sharks... they were hunting the rays which were super active this morning the rays were active at ankle and calf depth. The sharks were at chest depth.. js..Lots of fishermen, so that draws them in. Just be aware of your surroundings

detailed_data.name: Crystal & Fantasy Caves
detailed_data.description: The Crystal and Fantasy Caves are a natural wonder. Formed over millions of years, these not-to-be-missed caves feature stunning azure underground pools and incredible formations of every size and shape imaginable. The lush sub-tropical gardens, unique gift shop and popular café make a visit to Crystal and Fantasy Caves an adventure for the whole family. Reservations are recommended, but not necessary. We advise guests book in advance by phone – 441 293 0640.

detailed_data.name: Cascade Falls
detailed_data.description: We did a quick walk down to the falls. It was impressive and pretty. There were a few people around so I didn’t get the greatest nature only picture but it was worth the 100+ steps down and back and only took maybe about 15 minutes.

detailed_data.name: George W. Childs Park
detailed_data.description: Gorgeous waterfalls. Easy walk around and in between them, and I remember coming here as a younger kid and loving it (when it’s warm wading in the water is nice).

detailed_data.name: Jackson Street Bridge
detailed_data.description: I bike past this bridge most days before and after work. It is incredibly frustrating to me as a biker that people think it's ok to park in the bike lanes on either side of the street. 1. It is illegal to park in a no parking zone, even with your emergency lights on (since it is not an emergency) 2. Can people just have some decency to park in the free parking at the MLK center and not block people's route home. Especially at night when it becomes dangerous to ride in the road when we know there are some crazy drivers in ATL.

detailed_data.name: Bridal Veil Falls
detailed_data.description: If you want to go down to the pool of the fall be prepared for a VERY steep treacherous climb down. No hand rails or stairs.  Then you have to climb back up.  I was unprepared for that so if your not in the best shape it could be dangerous. They do have a short walk to a lookout.

detailed_data.name: Mount St. Helens
detailed_data.description: While access to the still-steaming crater is forbidden, tourists flock to see what remains of this famous volcano.

detailed_data.name: Marshall’s Beach
detailed_data.description: This is a calm beach with a unique angle and close overlook or viewpoint for the Golden Gate. It is neither the only overlook viewpoint nor the best one. A resident person or a repeater visitor would have a better recommendation for an overlook viewpoint.

detailed_data.name: The Great Jack O'lantern Blaze (2025) - All You Need to Know BEFORE You Go (with Reviews)
detailed_data.description: On the last night of our recent New England tour, we went to the Great Jack-O-Lantern Blaze, which was near to the places we went in Sleepy Hollow and Tarrytown NY. I’m not a big Halloween fan, but I was surprised to find that this was very interesting and a great show of creativity. There were about a bazillion pumpkins used in the displays. We found sweatshirts and caps sufficient for the quite cool mid-October weather, but the weather was clear.  It was bigger than I had expected, but not overly long for being out at night. I do not care for typical Halloween activities such as haunted houses and spook alleys, but found this very upbeat and cheery, not scarey. We spent about 45 min. to an hour, which seemed a good amount of time to see everything.

detailed_data.name: Teatro Dell'Opera Di Roma
detailed_data.description: Old school vibe from the very beginning is the only way to describe the Esquilino neighborhood. The Esquilino takes pride in being one of the oldest areas in Rome for its key location on one of the city’s famous seven hills. From an ancient neighborhood to its modern incarnation as a multicultural hub, Esquilino always has something going on—polyglot vendors debate street artists while kids play pick-up basketball games. Look around you: this area isn’t like the historic center. Liberty architecture, large piazzas, and long boulevards mix with archaic arches, secret side alleys, and beautiful churches like Santa Maria Maggiore.

detailed_data.name: Arctic Circle Husky Park (2025) - All You Need to Know BEFORE You Go (with Reviews)
detailed_data.description: The husky ride at Rovaniemi Husky Park is an absolute must. This was easily one of the most unforgettable experiences of our  trip to Lapland. The sled ride itself was pure magic. Our musher was fantastic—knowledgeable, kind, and happy to answer all our questions. What made this experience even more special was learning about the individual dogs. Overall, this was a heartwarming and thrilling experience I’ll never forget. Whether you’re a dog lover, nature enthusiast, or just looking for something uniquely Arctic, you won’t regret this. We would love to come back!

Street Kart is in no way a reflection of Nintendo, the game 'Mario Kart'.(We do not provide rental of costumes of Mario Series.) Dress up in your favorite character costume, playing the music of your choice and driving through the city of Tokyo. All eyes on you guarantee! You can ride with a group or ride privately, Street Kart is fully equipped to make your experience a very important one. Every airboat tour includes your own personalized photo (with your own camera) holding our resident baby gator, Lucy. Get 10% at the Black Hammock Restaurant using your airboat ride ticket stub. Great for the whole family! Our on-site restaurant serves up your favorite Florida delicacies fresh daily. Try our Catfish Nuggets, Gator Bites, or Bangin' Shrimp! The Lazy Gator bar is open seven days a week and serves 2-4-1 Margaritas all day every day. Book your event with us! detailed_data.name: Sedona, AZ
detailed_data.description: I came here because I've heard I need to come out to check it out and visit. Well, I came out and all I can say is overhyped, overpriced, and a tourist trap. It's full of old people who have a difficult time driving the speed limit. The weather is good because I'm out here in October and the scenery is very beautiful, but it's very overcrowded and parking is impossible. I looked for a spot to park for an hour and couldn't find anything so I left. I stopped off at Garland's Indian Jewelry when I was outside of town, but that's all I could visit. Go up to Jackson Hole, WY.

detailed_data.name: 54 Traditions Gallery
detailed_data.description: 54 Traditions Gallery is the only gallery in Vietnam focusing on the antiques, artifacts and art of Vietnam’s 54 ethnic groups. We have a room dedicated to each of the following categories: The Central Highlands, Tribal Textiles, The Shamanic Tradition, Functional Objects, Water Puppets and Stone and Bronze Antiques. Our approach is “anthropological”- we believe that the value and appreciation of an object is increased when we know what it is , when and why it was made and who made it, who used it, why it looks the way it does. We have over 1000 objects on display and objects from our collection have been exhibited in national museums in Hanoi. All objects are guaranteed to be as described and accompanied by a Fact Sheet of at least 1000 words, giving the details on the people who made the object, materials used, purpose, and probable age. We work with numerous museums in VN, USA, and elsewhere. Our price range is very broad, with objects under $20 and over $1000.

Everyone throws fire on his pot, but so maybe it's a bit exaggerated....

detailed_data.name: Cascada de Tamul
detailed_data.description: My husband (71, good health) and I (65, bad hips, broke knee in August) embarked on our first Potosina adventure with trepidation, but we ended up loving it.After a delicious breakfast at Kapul (restaurant across the street from our hotel, highly recommended), our guide, Carlos of Diversion Huasteca, met us at our hotel in Ciudad Valle (Casa Ortiz, also highly recommended).Carlos then drove us and another family (mother with 3 grown sons) about an hour to the Tamul Waterfall for our first day in the Huasteca Potosina. We stopped on the way to pick up water shoes (indispensable - I hated them and thought I could do the whole thing barefoot or in my flipflops and I was SO glad I listened to Carlos), a waterproof cellphone case and a snack.We parked on the highway then hiked down a beautiful rolling hillside (fairly flat, a few stairs) about 1km to the unbelievable river, where our panga awaited us, with our boatman Jume. We donned lifejackets and grabbed our paddles, then headed upriver, a 4km trip against a slight current in absolutely spectacularly aquamarine blue water.I am an experienced kayaker and had no trouble with the paddle, but if I had, the others could have easily picked up the slack as it was not arduous. Our boatman pulled the panga over the portage mid-trip, and we walked along a track on the river about 400m. It was an easy and beautiful walk, then we canoed the rest of the way to the falls.On the way, we canoed under a low cascade that was both refreshing and exhilarating. It really felt like an adventure, as the water roared down, the mosses glistened and the maidenhair ferns waved at us through the spray.We didn't get that close to the falls themselves as the current was too strong, but we all clambered up a rock so Carlos could take our photo, with the cascade as a backdrop.We passed a number of other pangas going and coming, and in each case we splashed each other ferociously. Very cool - literally and figuratively. So there were other tourists there, but it didn't feel crowded, and there were plenty of stretches of river where it was just us and the cliffs on either side of use - and one small crocodile sunning himself, a bunch of muddy turtles, and lots of different kinds of birds.Heading back, we stopped just above the smaller waterfall and climbed up some stairs (about 30) to the spring in a cave where the small waterfall begins. The cave was full of stalactites and the rocks at the entrance were smoothly coated with the limestone sediment, so getting in was easy. I swam to the back of the cave (tricky in my lifejacket, but they are required) about 20m.Then we walked down the stairs and played in the pools created at the top of the falls in the limestone, with outcroppings of rock crowned by tufts of green - ferns, moss, trees, vines - making the rushing waters eddy and foam and whirl. It was like a fantastic outdoor jacuzzi.We finished our trip back where we started, and though the walk back to the car seemed longer than the trip going (and my shoulder was a bit stiff), we collapsed happily for the drive to lunch.Then Carlos drove us a short was to a restaurant on a fish hatchery pond. My husband and I split bagre zarandeado (catfish grilled with a non-spicy chili marinade), which was delicious, and cold Topochico with lime. So refreshing and we were SOO hungry!Sleep and replete, Carlos drove us all back to our hotels, ready for the next day of our Potosina adventure.

detailed_data.name: Mandalay Bay Beach
detailed_data.description: This is what being a resortist is all about. Voted by Trip Advisor as one of the best pools in the U.S. Mandalay Bay's world-famous aquatic playground features 2,700 tons of real sand, a 1.6 million gallon wave pool and 100 rentable cabanas, day beds, bungalows and personalized villas. The Beach is open seasonally.

detailed_data.name: Ringwood State Park
detailed_data.description: I last visited Ringwood Manor as a teenager , about 50 years ago , and looked forward to a return with my lady . The mansion is , fortunately , still fairly well maintained , while other aspects of the park had some glaring issues : 1 ) Very small lavatories for such a big facility , with no soap and no employees competent enough to fill the dispensers 2 ) No signage describing the grounds or artifacts as you walked around 3 ) We needed cash for a tour , as the credit card machine wasn't working well 4 ) Our very gentle , patient and considerate young guide knew the estate's history , but virtually nothing about the time periods in which the estate was so prominent , from the American Revolution through the Civil War , knowing absolutely nothing about Peter Cooper's role as an abolitionist and Lincoln supporter ( he politely listened to my input ) ................ Mind you , this is perhaps New Jersey's finest , most well p[reserved 18th-19th century historic site ! ........ Again , the staff was very friendly and accommodating , but some improvements are definitely in order !

detailed_data.name: Women's Massage Center by Ex-Prisoners
detailed_data.description:
When I first heard about massages from ex-prisoners, I was skeptical—imagining a gimmicky tourist trap with prison-themed decor. But that couldn’t be further from the truth. This was one of the best massages of my life!

I was lucky to get a 2-hour Thai massage from Nuree (I wish I had written her name down), who was incredibly professional. She adjusted her pressure based on my breathing and used her forearms and elbows with expert precision.

I opted for the 2-hour massage with oil, which can sometimes feel routine, but in Nuree’s hands, it was magical. The oil had a Tiger Balm-like quality that complemented the massage perfectly.

Massage Tip: Go in the morning! They get busy in the afternoon, but after the initial rush, it slows down. I arrived at 10 AM and had the place to myself by 11. Highly recommend this experience!

detailed_data.name: Phillips Cruises and Tours
detailed_data.description: See it all in one day! Phillips Cruises & Tours operates the 26 Glacier Cruise and Glacier Quest Cruise from Whittier, Alaska. View dynamic glaciers and curious wildlife up close while enjoying the spectacular beauty of Prince William Sound. Depending on the cruise you choose, you can explore the serenity of Esther Passage, view majestic glaciers in College Fjord, or see Yosemite-scale waterfalls and glistening glaciers in Blackstone Bay. Watch for playful sea otters, harbor seals, kittiwakes, bears, whales, or mountain goats. Our Captain and a Chugach National Forest Service ranger provide narration. A delicious hot meal is served after departure. A full-service bar with beer, wine, cocktails, and snacks for purchase is available. Ask about our NO Seasickness Guarantee. Travel in first-class comfort on the fastest catamarans in Alaska. Our fleet offers a smoke-free environment with clean restrooms, reserved seating, and ADA access. Enjoy the drive or add Coach service.

detailed_data.name: Gooseberry Beach
detailed_data.description: Located along the iconic Ocean Drive, this white sand beach is nestled in a quiet cove, boasting calm and gentle waters—perfect for swimming and snorkeling. There are minimal amenities, so come prepared with food and drinks, beach chairs, and anything you need for a relaxing day at the beach. Otherwise, there's always the nearby Gooseberry Cafe for quick bites. The beach closes by the early evening, so you may want to start your day in the morning to maximize your trip and the per-vehicle entrance fee, especially during the busy summer months. – Tripadvisor

detailed_data.name: Mark Twain Riverboat Dinner Cruise
detailed_data.description: My husband and I went on this dinner cruise on a chilly, windy April evening. The rain had stopped so we could walk the 4 blocks to the dock/ port. You do need to reserve before hand, limited seats, especially this early in the season. People were very friendly, service good, food very good, saxophone was very nice! Singer/ server did a nice job too!! The rain and clouds were gone so there was a beautiful sunset over the River!! We did walk outside and up to the top to see from there. Very chilly!! Didn’t stay outside for long!!We would have liked a little information about what we were seeing once in awhile while traveling on the river. We enjoyed the 2 hours on the Old Steam Paddle Boat.

detailed_data.name: Antelope Canyon Navajo Tours (2025) - All You Need to Know BEFORE You Go (with Reviews)
detailed_data.description: Wow, Upper Antelope Canyon was such a unique and awe-inspiring experience, and our tour with Antelope Canyon Navajo Tours, led by Thomas H., was fantastic! From the moment we met him, Thomas was incredibly nice and friendly, making everyone in our group feel welcome. He was a wealth of information, patiently answering all our questions and sharing fascinating insights about the canyon's history, the surrounding nature, and the rich Navajo culture. What really stood out was how Thomas helped us capture the beauty of the canyon ourselves – he took some great photos of our family and even shared his tips and tricks for getting amazing shots with our own cameras. Plus, he was a very skilled driver navigating the sandy desert roads! Thomas was patient, had a great sense of humor, and his knowledge truly enhanced our visit. The meeting spot for the tour was also easy to find, which made the whole experience smooth and enjoyable. I highly recommend taking a tour with Antelope Canyon Navajo Tours and if you can, ask for Thomas H. – he made our visit truly memorable!
